hackathon-description-text: SpartaHack 2017 is Michigan State University's third annual student-run hackathon. On the weekend of January 20th, we're bringing together 500 students of all skill levels and disciplines to get creative with tech, connect with peers and professionals, and forget the words "I can't." We're excited to see what you will create!
hackathon-eligibility:
- 
- Teams can have a maximum of 4 members.
- All team members must be registered SpartaHack attendees.
- All team members must be physically present at SpartaHack.
hackathon-rules:
- Projects must consist entirely of original code. Public libraries may be used, but projects may not be extensions of existing codebases.
- All project code must be written in the 36 hours between 12:00 AM EST on Saturday, January 21, 2017 and 11:59 AM EST on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Projects must be submitted to spartahack2017.devpost.com by 11:59 AM EST on Sunday, January 22, 2017.
- All project code must be written exclusively by the team members listed in the final submission. Teams may use reference materials and receive technical instruction from mentors or other attendees, but no external source may directly contribute to the project code.
- Project ideas must be independent and original in spirit. Although they may be inspired by or improvements on ideas previously implemented by others, projects must offer substantial novelty.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 to split + $3000 SendGrid credits + 6 months of Loader.io + 1 year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro
$750 to split +$1560 in SendGrid credits + 1 year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro
$500 to split + 1 year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro
$400 to split + $200 in Shapeways 3D printing credit

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack for Social Good with preference for using a Michigan-based open dataset

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Software keys for Snagit and Camtasia + 4 $100 Amex gift cards
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Use of Public Web APIs
Best Integration of X-keys with Other Hardware

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1 Year of Wolfram Development Platform + Wolfram Mathematica Student Edition + Wolfram|Alpha Pro
Amazon Echo for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Voice User Experience Using Amazon Alexa

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 to split + a sweatshirt blanket for each team member
$200 Amazon gift card to split + $100 in Cycle platform credit for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Security in a Mobile Environment

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Beats headphones for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack for Improving Access to Legal Services
Best Use of Amazon Web Services
Best Domain Name Registered with Domain.com
Best Hack to Reduce Online Harassment

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi 3 Model B for each team member + $200 to split

hackathon-description-header: Michigan State University's third annual, 500 student, 36-hour hackathon!
